intro: Peperomia santanderana, commonly known as the Santander peperomia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant features oval, waxy leaves that are typically green with a slight reddish tinge on the underside. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually borne in clusters near the base of the plant. Peperomia santanderana is well adapted to shady, humid environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
